intro: Ornithogalum bohemicum, commonly known as the Bohemian star-of-Bethlem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, grass-like foliage and bell-shaped, white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its bulbs are bulbous and store nutrients, allowing it to survive through winter dormancy. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
